VI.ii.5.2.b
.
Elections Involving Increases in VA Compensation
When a Veteran receives compensation for a service-connected (SC) disability and OWCP later awards FEC because the same disability was aggravated by an on-the-job injury,
the Veteran must make an election between FEC and any future increases in compensation that are attributable to the same disability, and
it is
not
necessary to determine whether or not future increases in the disability rating of the disability at issue is related to the on-the-job injury.
Note
:  Once FEC has been awarded for a disability, all subsequent increases in compensation related to the
same
disability are subject to election.
Reference
:  For examples of cases involving increases in VA compensation, see
M21-1, Part VI, Subpart ii, 5.4.b
-
d
and
f
.
